Structs/FileDescriptor/SeekOrigin.html.name: SeekOrigin
Structs/FileDescriptor/SeekOrigin.html.abstract: Options for specifying what a file descriptor’s offset is relative to.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: open(_:)
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Open or creates, if does not exist, file.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: close()
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Flushes the associated stream and closes the file.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: read(into:)
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Reads bytes at the current file offset into a buffer

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: read(fromAbsoluteOffest:into:)
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Reads bytes at the specified offset into a buffer.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: seek(offset:from:)
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Reposition the offset for the given file descriptor.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: write(_:)
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Writes the contents of a buffer at the current file offset.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: write(_:)
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Writes the contents of a string at the current file offset.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: write(toAbsoluteOffset:_:)
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Writes the contents of a buffer at the specified offset.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.name: sync()
Structs/FileDescriptor.html#/s:7SwiftIO1.abstract: Flushes any cached write of an open file.

Structs/FileDescriptor.html.name: FileDescriptor
Structs/FileDescriptor.html.abstract: The FileDescriptor struct is used to perform low-level file operations.

Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO4wait2usySi_tF.name: wait(us:)
Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO4wait2usySi_tF.abstract: When you invoke the wait function, the CPU keeps on working and checking if the time set (in microsecondï¼‰is up. In addition, this function is more accurate than the sleep function.

Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO5sleep2msySi_t.name: sleep(ms:)
Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO5sleep2msySi_t.abstract: The sleep function will suspend the processor’s work in a given time period (in millisecond).

Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO22getPowerUpMi.name: getPowerUpMilliseconds()
Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO22getPowerUpMi.abstract: Get the elapsed time in millisecond since the board powered up.

Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO13getClockCycl.name: getClockCycle()
Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO13getClockCycl.abstract: Get the current clock cycle of the low level 32bit timer.

Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO19cyclesToNano.name: cyclesToNanoseconds(start:stop:)
Functions.html#/s:7SwiftIO19cyclesToNano.abstract: Convert the clock cycle into nanoseconds. This function is usually used together with getClockCycle().

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC11set.name: setBaudrate(_:)
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC11set.abstract: Set the baud rate for communication. It should be set ahead of time to ensure the same baud rate between two devices.

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC11cle.name: clearBuffer()
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC11cle.abstract: Clear all bytes from the buffer to store the incoming data.

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC19che.name: checkBufferReceived()
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC19che.abstract: Return the number of received data from the serial buffer.

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC5writ.name: write(_:)
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC5writ.abstract: Write a byte of data to the external device through the serial connection.

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC5writ.name: write(_:)
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC5writ.abstract: Write a series of bytes to the external device through the serial connection.

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC5writ.name: write(_:)
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC5writ.abstract: Write a string to the external device through the serial connection.

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC8read.name: readByte(timeout:)
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC8read.abstract: Read a byte of data receiving from the external device. The maximum time for data reception is decided by the timeout value. If the data is received before the time set, the read process will end up automatically.

Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC4read.name: read(count:timeout:)
Classes/UART.html#/s:7SwiftIO4UARTC4read.abstract: Read a series of bytes receiving from the external device.The maximum time for data reception is decided by the timeout value. If the data is received before the time set, the read process will end up automatically.

Classes/UART/Parity.html.name: Parity
Classes/UART/Parity.html.abstract: The parity bit is used to ensure the data transmission according to the number of logical-high bits.

Classes/UART/StopBits.html.name: StopBits
Classes/UART/StopBits.html.abstract: One or two stops bits are reserved to end the communication.

Classes/UART/DataBits.html.name: DataBits
Classes/UART/DataBits.html.abstract: This indicates the length of the data being transmitted.

Classes/UART/BufferLength.html.name: BufferLength
Classes/UART/BufferLength.html.abstract: This indicates the storage size of the serial buffer.

Classes/Timer.html#/s:7SwiftIO5TimerC12s.name: setInterrupt(ms:mode:start:_:)
Classes/Timer.html#/s:7SwiftIO5TimerC12s.abstract: Execute a designated task at a scheduled time interval. The task should be executed in a very short time, usually in nanoseconds.

Classes/Timer.html#/s:7SwiftIO5TimerC5cl.name: clear()
Classes/Timer.html#/s:7SwiftIO5TimerC5cl.abstract: Clear the timer. The timer will be reset to inital value.

Classes/Timer/Mode.html.name: Mode
Classes/Timer/Mode.html.abstract: There are two timer modes: if set to oneShot, the interrupt happens only once; if set to period, the interrupt happens continuously.

Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC_5speed.name: init(_:speed:)
Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC_5speed.abstract: Initialize a specified interface for SPI communication as a master device.

Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC8getSpe.name: getSpeed()
Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC8getSpe.abstract: Get the current clock speed of SPI communication.

Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC8readBy.name: readByte()
Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC8readBy.abstract: Read a byte of data from the slave device.

Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC4read5c.name: read(count:)
Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC4read5c.abstract: Read an array of data from the slave device.

Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC5writey.name: write(_:)
Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC5writey.abstract: Write a byte of data to the slave device.

Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC5writey.name: write(_:)
Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC5writey.abstract: Write an array of data to the slave device.

Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC5writey.name: write(_:)
Classes/SPI.html#/s:7SwiftIO3SPIC5writey.abstract: Write raw data to the slave device.

Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC_.name: init(_:frequency:dutycycle:)
Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC_.abstract: Initialize a PWM output on a specified pin.

Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC3.name: set(frequency:dutycycle:)
Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC3.abstract: Set the frequency and the dutycycle of a PWM output signal. The value of the dutycycle should be a float between 0.0 and 1.0.

Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC3.name: set(period:pulse:)
Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC3.abstract: Set the period and pulse width of a PWM output signal.

Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC1.name: setDutycycle(_:)
Classes/PWMOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO6PWMOutC1.abstract: Set the duty cycle of a PWM output signal, that’s to say, set the duration of the on-state of a signal. The value should be a float between 0.0 and 1.0.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC_5speed.name: init(_:speed:)
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC_5speed.abstract: Initialize a specific I2C interface as a master device.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC8getSpe.name: getSpeed()
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC8getSpe.abstract: Get the current clock speed of the data transmission.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC8setSpe.name: setSpeed(_:)
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC8setSpe.abstract: Set the clock speed to change the transmission rate.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC8readBy.name: readByte(from:)
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC8readBy.abstract: Read one byte from a specified slave device with the given address.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC4read5c.name: read(count:from:)
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC4read5c.abstract: Read an array of data from a specified slave device with the given address.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC5write_.name: write(_:to:)
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC5write_.abstract: Write a byte of data to a specified slave device with the given address.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC5write_.name: write(_:to:)
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC5write_.abstract: Write an array of data to a specified slave device with the given address.

Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC9writeR.name: writeRead(_:readCount:address:)
Classes/I2C.html#/s:7SwiftIO3I2CC9writeR.abstract: Write an array of bytes to the slave device with the given address and then read the bytes sent from the device.

Classes/I2C/Speed.html.name: Speed
Classes/I2C/Speed.html.abstract: The clock signal is used to synchronize the data transmission between the devices.There are three available speed grades.

Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.name: init(_:mode:value:)
Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.abstract: Initialize a DigitalOut to a specific output pin.

Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.name: getMode()
Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.abstract: Return the current output mode in a format of DigitalOut.Mode enumerate.

Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.name: write(_:)
Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.abstract: Set the output value of the specific pin: true for high voltage and false for low voltage.

Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.name: toggle()
Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.abstract: Reverse the current output value of the specific pin.

Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.name: getValue()
Classes/DigitalOut.html#/s:7SwiftIO10Dig.abstract: Get the current output value in Boolean format.

Classes/DigitalOut/Mode.html.name: Mode
Classes/DigitalOut/Mode.html.abstract: The Mode enumerate includes the available output modes. The default output mode in most cases is pushPull. The pushPull mode enables the digital pin to output high and low voltage levels while the open-drain output cannot truly output a high level.

Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.name: init(_:mode:)
Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.abstract: Initialize a DigitalIn to a specified pin.

Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.name: getMode()
Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.abstract: Get the current input mode on a specified pin.

Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.name: setMode(_:)
Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.abstract: Set the input mode for a digital input pin.

Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.name: read()
Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.abstract: Read the value from a digital input pin.

Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.name: setInterrupt(_:enable:callback:)
Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.abstract: Add a callback function to a specified digital pin to set interrupt by detcting the changes of the signal. Once the risng or falling edge is detected, the processor will suspend the normal execution to execute the designated task.

Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.name: enableInterrupt()
Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.abstract: Trigger the interrupt after detecting the edge.

Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.name: disableInterrupt()
Classes/DigitalIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO9Digit.abstract: Disable the interrupt until the interrupt state is changed.

Classes/DigitalIn/Mode.html.name: Mode
Classes/DigitalIn/Mode.html.abstract: The digital input modes can change the default state (high, low or floating) of a pin by using the pull resistors.

Classes/DigitalIn/InterruptMode.html.name: InterruptMode
Classes/DigitalIn/InterruptMode.html.abstract: The interrupt mode determines the edge to raise the interrupt: rising, falling or both edges. A rising edge is the transition of a digital input signal from high to low and a falling edge is from low to high.

Classes/DigitalIn/InterruptState.html.name: InterruptState
Classes/DigitalIn/InterruptState.html.abstract: The interrupt state determines whether the interrupt will be enabled and occur.

Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.name: setMode(_:)
Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.abstract: Change the mode to decide whether it detects the rising edge or both rising and falling edges.

Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.name: read()
Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.abstract: Read the number of edges that has been detected.

Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.name: start()
Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.abstract: Start the counter to measure the value.

Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.name: clear()
Classes/Counter.html#/s:7SwiftIO7Counter.abstract: Clear the value of counter, it will set the value to 0.

Classes/Counter/Mode.html.name: Mode
Classes/Counter/Mode.html.abstract: The Mode enumerate is to decide whether the count detects the rising edge or both rising and falling edges.

Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.name: maxRawValue
Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.abstract: The max raw value of the ADC. Different ADC has different resolutions. The max raw value of an 8-bit ADC is 255 and that one of a 10-bit ADC is 4095.

Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.name: init(_:)
Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.abstract: Initialize an AnalogIn to a specified pin.

Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.name: readRawValue()
Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.abstract: Read the current raw value from the specified analog pin.

Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.name: readPercent()
Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.abstract: Read the input voltage in percentage from a specified analog pin.

Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.name: readVoltage()
Classes/AnalogIn.html#/s:7SwiftIO8Analog.abstract: Read the input voltage from a specified analog pin.

Classes/AnalogIn.html.name: AnalogIn
Classes/AnalogIn.html.abstract: The AnalogIn class is used to read the external voltage applied to an analog input pin.

Classes/Counter.html.name: Counter
Classes/Counter.html.abstract: The counter class can be used to count the external signal and measure the number of the pulse. It can detect the rising edge or both edges.

Classes/DigitalIn.html.name: DigitalIn
Classes/DigitalIn.html.abstract: The DigitalIn class is intended to detect the state of a digital input pin. The input value is either true(1) or false(0).

Classes/DigitalOut.html.name: DigitalOut
Classes/DigitalOut.html.abstract: The DigitalOut class is used to set a High or Low voltage output to a digital output pin. An initiation is required before using the member functions of this class.

Classes/I2C.html.name: I2C
Classes/I2C.html.abstract: I2C (I square C) is a two wire protocol to communicate between different devices. The I2C class allows some operations through I2C protocol, including reading messages from a device and writing messages to a device.

Classes/PWMOut.html.name: PWMOut
Classes/PWMOut.html.abstract: The PWMOut class is used to vary the output voltage by controlling the duration of high output in the time periodCycles on the pin.

Classes/SPI.html.name: SPI
Classes/SPI.html.abstract: SPI is a four wire serial protocol for communication between devices.

Classes/Timer.html.name: Timer
Classes/Timer.html.abstract: The Timer class is used to set the occasion to raise the interrupt.

Classes/UART.html.name: UART
Classes/UART.html.abstract: UART is a two-wire serial communication protocol used to communicate with serial devices. The devices must agree on a common transmisson rate before communication.
